cmCourseInfo.description: Introduction to management and its subdisciplines. Themes include business in a Canadian context, the nature of corporations, corporate governance, organizational behavior, operations, and strategy.
cmCourseInfo.title: Fundamentals of Management

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
Rotman Commerce students are not allowed to enroll in this course. This course is designated for all Arts & Science students on St. George Campus.

cmCourseInfo.description: Introduction to financial reporting and analysis that is used by companies to organize and evaluate data in light of their organization’s goal. Emphasis is on decision-making and interpretation of financial statements and how they can be used to plan a firm’s overall business activities through the use of real-world companies. Not open to Rotman Commerce students. Not eligible for CR/NCR option. Contact Rotman Commerce for details.
cmCourseInfo.title: Introduction to Financial Accounting

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
For Students in an approved Rotman Commerce Partner Program (Actuarial Science, Employment Relations and Human Resources Management), please visit our website for more information on eligibility: https://rotmancommerce.utoronto.ca/resource/timetables/
